meaning: Division; separation, as of compound substances.
example: His latest statements seemed to depart from party policy somewhat.

meaning: Of or pertaining to a department.
The act of departing or something that has departed.
example: The departure was scheduled for noon.

meaning: A reliable person or thing.
example: He was a very dependable person.

meaning: The state of being dependent, of relying upon another.
example: He had a deep dependence on her for guidance.

meaning: (grammar) An adjective (or other descriptive word)
To mark out and make known; to point out; to indicate; to show; to distinguish by marks or description
example: to designate the boundaries of a country

meaning: A thing that people want; something that is desirable.
example: There are plenty of desirables on display in the window.

meaning: The top surface of a desk.
example: Laptops are often more expensive than desktops.

meaning: A person in desperate circumstances or who is at the point of desperation, such as a down-and-outer, addict, etc.
example: I hadn't eaten in two days and was desperate for food.

meaning: A sweet confection served as the last course of a meal
The act of destining or appointing.
To take apart from; to take off.
example: to detach the tag from a newly purchased garment

meaning: To make worse; to make inferior in quality or value; to impair.
example: to deteriorate the mind

meaning: To ruin many or all things over a large area, such as most or all buildings of a city, or cities of a region, or trees of a forest.
A person or entity engaged in the creation or improvement of certain classes of products.
To determine which disease is causing a sick person's signs and symptoms; to find the diagnosis.
Any technique used in medical diagnosis.
A plan, drawing, sketch or outline to show how something works, or show the relationships between the parts of a whole.
example: Electrical diagrams show device interconnections.

meaning: A graduated, circular scale over which a needle moves to show a measurement (such as speed).
example: President Trump has recently dialled down the rhetoric.

meaning: A glimmering glass-like mineral that is an allotrope of carbon in which each atom is surrounded by four others in the form of a tetrahedron.
example: The saw is coated with diamond.

meaning: Dinnertime
One who dines.
A document issued by an educational institution testifying that the recipient has earned a degree or has successfully completed a particular course of study.
A list of names, addresses etc, of specific classes of people or organizations, often in alphabetical order or in some classification.
To render unable; to take away an ability of, as by crippling.
example: Falling off the horse disabled him.

meaning: An argument or debate.
example: They had a bit of a disagreement about what color to paint the bedroom, but they have reached a compromise.

meaning: A feeling of sadness or frustration when a strongly held expectation is not met.
example: Our trip to California was a disappointment.

meaning: Anything discarded.
A break or interruption in an existing connection, continuum, or process; disconnection.
example: There's a disconnect between what they think is happening and what is really going on.

meaning: To interrupt the continuance of; to put an end to, especially as regards commercial productions; to stop producing, making, or supplying something.
example: They plan to discontinue that design.

meaning: An inconsistency between facts or sentiments.
example: They found a discrepancy between the first set of test results and the second, and they're still trying to figure out why.

meaning: An intense dislike or loathing someone feels for something bad or nasty.
example: With an air of disgust, she stormed out of the room.

meaning: A machine for washing dishes.
An attitude or a feeling of distaste or aversion.
example: Tell me your likes and dislikes.

meaning: A message sent quickly, as a shipment, a prompt settlement of a business, or an important official message sent by a diplomat, or military officer.
example: We must act with dispatch in this matter.

meaning: An arrangement, categorization or classification of things.
The disposal or management of something.
example: I dispose of my trash in the garbage can.

meaning: To throw into confusion or disorder.
example: Hecklers disrupted the man's speech.

meaning: An interruption to the regular flow or sequence of something.
example: There was great disruption in the classroom when the teacher left.

meaning: To fail to satisfy; to displease.
To divert the attention of.
example: The crowd was distracted by a helicopter hovering over the stadium when the only goal of the game was scored.

meaning: Something that distracts.
example: Poking one's eye is a good distraction from a hurting toe.

meaning: An act of distributing or state of being distributed.
example: The distribution of my little rock magazine is about 3,000.

meaning: One who or that which distributes.
